column1: Ibiá is a Brazilian municipality located in the west of the state of Minas Gerais. Its population as of 2007 was estimated to be 22
column2: 069 people living in a total area of 2
column3: 707 km². The city belongs to the mesoregion of Triângulo Mineiro and Alto Paranaíba and to the micro-region of Araxá.  It became a municipality in 1923.

column4: is 324 km.   Neighboring  municipalities are:  Serra do Salitre and Rio Paranaíba (N)

column1: Ibiá is an indigenous name meaning "High Plateaus"
column2: due to the geographical location of the town.
